metadata.synopsis: After you recruit the gith, you can click on it to get the following set of questions. The gith will always be semi-hostile at this point. She comes from a hostile land and has been infected by her mortal enemy; she is not here to make friends.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_MAin_A3. Recruit Lae'zel4. Talk with her.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: Speak! Have you killed our queen's enemy?
9.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

363.speaker: Lae'zel
363.text: Speak! Have you killed my queen's enemy?
363.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

255.speaker: Player
255.text: I'm not going to kill them. They protect us from the Absolute.
255.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Blasphemy. She warned you not to trust the one inside!
36.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

221.speaker: Narrator
221.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

287.speaker: Player
287.text: Open your mind, let Lae'zel into your memories.
287.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

275.speaker: Narrator
275.text: *Your thoughts become one. She sees the truth of your confrontation in an instant.*

332.speaker: Player
332.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

365.speaker: Lae'zel
365.text: *Lae'zel slithers into your brain despite your resistance. She sees the truth of your confrontation in an instant.*
365.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *Lae'zel slithers into your brain despite your resistance. She sees the truth of your confrontation in an instant.*
157.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: Vlaakith tavki na'zin. I see only - only madness. Vlaakith bears the full might of Tu'narath's arms, and the covenant of the great Mother Gith!
95.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: We must go to the ch'r'ai. He will summon Vlaakith - she must know of this... this apostate.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: Tsk'va! We are leaving this place - now.

268.speaker: Lae'zel
268.text: Vlaakith tavki na'zin. I see only - only madness. My queen knows my faith. She would never condemn me.
268.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith TAHV-key nah-ZINN - Vlaakith, show us truth

213.text: Tsk'va! You defy me - which means you have something to hide.

251.speaker: Lae'zel
251.text: Tsk'va! You defy me - which means you have something to hide.

144.speaker: Lae'zel
144.text: The ch'r'ai is waiting. You will tell him what you saw, or your corpse will be the next thrown in the crèche's burial pit.

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: I'm tempted to claw your brain from your skull just to see what secrets slither inside -

296.speaker: Lae'zel
296.text: Fortunate for you that head of yours has proven useful. We are leaving this place - now.

309.speaker: Lae'zel
309.text: But you've proven moderately useful. I will await word from Vlaakith. You may live for now.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: The Inquisitor is going to kill you, Lae'zel. Is that proof enough of my honour?

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: I've a mind to end you here and now, but you either believe your own words - or have suddenly mastered the duplicitous arts.

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: I've a mind to end you here and now, but you either believe your own words - or have suddenly mastered the duplicitous arts.

264.speaker: Lae'zel
264.text: To the inquisitor - and let us see who speaks with serpent's tongue.

150.text: You expect me to believe you? The inquisitor is Vlaakith's judgement made flesh. My Queen would not abandon me!

220.speaker: Lae'zel
220.text: You expect me to believe you? The inquisitor is Vlaakith's judgement made flesh. My Queen would not abandon me!

263.speaker: Lae'zel
263.text: To the inquisitor - and let him slice out your lying tongue.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Stay out of my mind. You have to believe me.

227.speaker: Lae'zel
227.text: I don't have to do anything.

342.speaker: Narrator
342.text: *The tingle becomes a strong buzz as Lae'zel's parasite nudges yours.*

311.speaker: Player
311.text: I'm afraid there was no one there.

143.speaker: Lae'zel
143.text: Impossible. Open your mind and show me.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: I tried, Lae'zel, but the target's unkillable.

235.speaker: Lae'zel
235.text: Unkillable? I don't believe you - show me your mind.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: Actually, I learned a few things. Your queen is lying to you.

340.speaker: Lae'zel
340.text: Vlaakith does not lie to Her faithful. Open your mind - show me.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: Bah. I tire of this Faerûn - its temperate skies, its soft people.
10.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, or at least as wistfully as Lae'zel could ever be.

167.speaker: Lae'zel
167.text: Would that I were doing battle among the Tears.
167.context: NodeContext: Tears = the kind you cry

105.speaker: Player
105.text: What do you mean by 'the Tears'?

359.speaker: Lae'zel
359.text: Look above. Watch the moon cross the sky.

259.speaker: Lae'zel
259.text: The Tears follow behind it. Rocky bodies tumbling through the Sea of Night. One of them is my crèche: K'liir.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Are all githyanki from the Tears?

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: Your curiosity is to be commended.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: Githyanki are hatched in crèches all throughout Realmspace. K'liir is one of many.

212.speaker: Lae'zel
212.text: It's there I first saw a kith'rak mount a red dragon. Where I slit my cousins' throats at the varsh's command.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: It must be quite a shock, to leave your crèche behind and arrive here.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: Do you think me so sheltered?

190.speaker: Lae'zel
190.text: My entire clutch battled beholders deep within the Eye of the Sky.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: We infiltrated a neogi Spelljammer and laid waste to its crew.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: The Tears span Toril's sky, vin'iisk. There is more to this realm than this grassy pebble.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Did you only train within the Tears?

326.speaker: Lae'zel
326.text: My entire clutch battled beholders within the Eye of the Sky's tunnels.

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: We infiltrated a neogi spelljammer and laid waste to its crew.

321.speaker: Lae'zel
321.text: The Tears span Toril's sky. There is more to the realm than this grassy pebble, vin'iisk.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: You mean you come from up there? In the sky?

337.speaker: Lae'zel
337.text: You are too easily astonished. There is more to this realm than this grassy pebble.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Faerûn isn't so bad. Give it a chance.

347.speaker: Lae'zel
347.text: I see naught but cowards cowering in their groves and grottos.

219.speaker: Lae'zel
219.text: Flowering meadows and fecund soil have softened their minds and muscles.

236.speaker: Lae'zel
236.text: They rely on strangers' swords, when they should be forging their own.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: You want to do battle where?

242.speaker: Player
242.text: The Tears of Selûne? They mar the sky - I'd extinguish them if I could.

252.speaker: Lae'zel
252.text: Extinguish the Tears? Your dedication to your goddess blinds you to their import.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: Look above, to the Sea of Night.

370.speaker: Lae'zel
370.text: Should you be fortunate, you may see Crèche K'liir tumble past.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: The Tears of Selûne, you mean?

345.speaker: Lae'zel
345.text: Yes. Rocky bodies named after a false goddess.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: The Tears of Selûne? I've spent many a night observing these celestial bodies.

180.speaker: Lae'zel
180.text: Perhaps we may see them this eve. Look above, to the Sea of Night.

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: To Baldur's Gate. If we're to be free of this parasite, we must slay these Chosen and their captive brain.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: We must make for the crèche.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: Only there can we be purified by a zaith'isk.

341.speaker: Lae'zel
341.text: The inquisitor must hear of the zaith'isk's failure.

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: I will find a way to contact Queen Vlaakith. She must know of the zaithisk's destruction, the inquisitor's failures.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: Wrench the Orphic Hammer from Raphael's grasp and we can free the Prince of the Comet.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: Voss stands at the ready. All that remains is to return to the Astral Prism and break Orpheus free.

151.speaker: Lae'zel
151.text: How we get in remains to be seen.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: Tsk'va! We have reached the abyss.

204.speaker: Lae'zel
204.text: I see no path to releasing the traitor prince, and no path to gutting him clean.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: It's taking all my will not to take your head in his place.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: I see no path to releasing Prince Orpheus, and no path to Vlaakith's demise.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: It's taking all my will not to take your head in her place.

148.speaker: Lae'zel
148.text: How fortunate for you that my obsession with you is so strong. Besides, I'm a practical woman.

300.speaker: Lae'zel
300.text: You are useful - for now. And we may yet find a way to gut the prince before he can fly free.
300.context: NodeContext: Simmering but has herself together

185.speaker: Lae'zel
185.text: But I cannot forever abide your disrespect. Cross me too often, and you will face the coming madness without me.

331.speaker: Lae'zel
331.text: You are useful - for now. And we may yet find a way to loose the Comet and see him fly free.
331.context: NodeContext: Simmering but has herself together

175.speaker: Lae'zel
175.text: How fortunate for you that I'm a practical woman.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.context: NodeContext: Arrogance-- 'why are you bothering me?'

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: I expected Baldur's Gate to be insipid, stale, wholly without merit.
43.context: NodeContext: Arrogance-- 'why are you bothering me?'

169.speaker: Lae'zel
169.text: But it's got a vicious bite to it. Delightful.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.context: NodeContext: Arrogance-- 'why are you bothering me?'

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.context: NodeContext: Arrogance-- 'why are you bothering me?'

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.context: NodeContext: Arrogance-- 'why are you bothering me?'

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: We must speak of recent events.

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: Attacking at night? Cowardly, if expected from desperate sellswords.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: All that remains is to return to the Astral Prism and break Orpheus free.

216.speaker: Lae'zel
216.text: How we get in remains to be seen.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: We're close. Soon, we'll slay the Netherbrain and end the Grand Design.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Are there other matters to discuss?

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: Are there other matters to discuss?

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: At last, the zaith'isk. Come, let us be purified.

101.speaker: Lae'zel
101.text: Voss is waiting beneath the city. We'll apprise him of our progress once we have the Orphic Hammer in hand.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: First, the Netherbrain falls. Then, I slay the traitorous prince.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: Approach with caution. One mistake could be costly.

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: Approach with caution. One mistake could be costly.

115.speaker: Lae'zel
115.text: Chk - be wary of false promises. The missing druid - Halsin, was it? He may be talented, but only a githyanki zaith'isk can cleanse an embedded tadpole.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: Voss was meeting someone in Sharess' Caress - someone who possesses the key to Orpheus' prison. We should find them at once.

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: Voss was meeting someone in Sharess' Caress - someone who possesses the key to Orpheus' prison. We should find them at once.

123.speaker: Lae'zel
123.text: We must press forward. Let's deal with Ketheric, then find Voss in Baldur's Gate.

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: A glorious day. We will slay the Netherbrain, and I will ascend to my queen.

130.speaker: Lae'zel
130.text: We must press forward. First, let's deal with Ketheric. Then, I will find a way to prove my faith to the Undying Queen.

136.speaker: Lae'zel
136.text: The crèche must be nested in that temple. Our cure is close.

147.speaker: Lae'zel
147.text: I can't unlock this from here.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: I've half a mind to tear your limbs off, one by one. By Mother Gith's silver sword, what were you thinking?

279.speaker: Player
279.text: I'm not as keen on Orpheus' release as you are, Lae'zel.

161.speaker: Lae'zel
161.text: We will return Orpheus to his people, or you will feel the heat of my fury.

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: On this, you have my word.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I like fighting githyanki. I thought I'd have a bit of fun.

301.speaker: Lae'zel
301.text: Is that so? Then who would I be to deny you your 'fun'? Htak'-a!

207.speaker: Player
207.text: It was a mistake. I got carried away.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: A mistake? Spilling your soup, mispronouncing a word - these are 'mistakes'.

261.speaker: Lae'zel
261.text: Attacking the prince's greatest champion? That is contempt.

228.speaker: Lae'zel
228.text: Our alliance grows fragile. See that you don't break it.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: Honestly? I just wanted to see how you'd react.
237.context: NodeContext: Angry but simmering - and hurt.

138.speaker: Lae'zel
138.text: Is my life nothing but a game of lanceboard to you? Is it your habit to smash the pieces as your finishing move?

274.speaker: Player
274.context: NodeContext: Angry but simmering - and hurt.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: Silence is all you can muster? An extraordinary show of contempt. Is our bond worth so little?
39.context: NodeContext: Angry but simmering - and hurt.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: I will not forgive this. And I will not forget this.

152.speaker: Lae'zel
152.text: Silence is all you can muster? An extraordinary show of contempt from one I've called ally.

160.speaker: Lae'zel
160.text: You let Voss live. I suppose I should be angry - but at this point, I'm simply amused.
160.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

265.speaker: Lae'zel
265.text: Besides. Why kill him, when we can torture him with the death of his beloved prince?

247.speaker: Lae'zel
247.text: We've got the hammer. Orpheus will die horribly - and Voss will suffer knowing he all but swung the sword that killed him.

162.speaker: Lae'zel
162.text: All that remains for us is to return to the Astral Prism and slaughter the false prince.
162.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

319.speaker: Lae'zel
319.text: How we get in remains to be seen.

165.speaker: Lae'zel
165.text: This devil Raphael flaunts his paltry wings, as if he wants to impress us.
165.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

334.speaker: Lae'zel
334.text: You saw the red dragons slaying his infernal kin above Hell's fires, did you not?
334.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

139.speaker: Lae'zel
139.text: Next to a dragon, the devil's a gnat. When I am kith'rak, I will take my Queen Vlaakith his head as a trophy.
139.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

128.speaker: Player
128.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

155.speaker: Lae'zel
155.text: Githyanki knights. The riders that chased the nautiloid. They are the commissars and enforcers of my Queen Vlaakith's will.

356.speaker: Lae'zel
356.text: Vlaakith bestows no greater honour. The bastard at the pass made a mockery of it.

119.speaker: Lae'zel
119.text: To wield a kith'rak's silver sword is my destiny.

330.speaker: Lae'zel
330.text: I will earn my Queen's favour. And I will conquer every layer of Hell, should she command it.

310.speaker: Lae'zel
310.text: Vlaakith bestows no greater honour. To wield a kith'rak's silver sword is my destiny.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Well we have no dragons at our disposal now, I'm afraid.
87.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

186.speaker: Lae'zel
186.text: I will sit astride one. It is only a matter of time.

240.speaker: Lae'zel
240.text: I will ride a red dragon. I will wield the silver sword. And I will conquer every layer of Hell, should my Queen command it.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: I found Raphael rather impressive, even if you didn't.
170.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: Steel and iron may be no match for him. But a githyanki knight's silver sword would pierce him through - even amid the fires of Avernus.
109.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

233.speaker: Lae'zel
233.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: I will ride a red dragon. I will wield the sword. And I will conquer every layer of Hell, should my Queen command it.
71.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Why were these knights chasing the mind flayer ship?
191.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

179.speaker: Lae'zel
179.text: The ghaik are our mortal enemy. It is not unusual for the kith'rak to give chase.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: To penetrate the Hells? This is unusual.

145.speaker: Lae'zel
145.text: But let us not question the wisdom of our Queen. We can see but to the horizon. Vlaakith's sight pierces the many planes.

135.speaker: Lae'zel
135.text: The ghaik are my kind's mortal enemy. It is not unusual for the kith'rak to give chase.

294.speaker: Lae'zel
294.text: To penetrate the Hells? This is unusual.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: But I am not one to question the wisdom of my Queen. I can see but to the horizon. Vlaakith's sight pierces the many planes.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: What are those dragons to the githyanki? Allies? Mounts? Pets?
86.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

328.speaker: Lae'zel
328.text: They are gifts to my Queen from the goddess Tiamat herself. They reside in the great city of Tu'narath, awaiting the privilege of battle.
328.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: Tiamat = TEE-uh-maht. Tun'narath = TOO-neh-rahth.(Sort of like tuna-roth.)

285.speaker: Lae'zel
285.text: Do not pity them. They reap great riches from their service - gold and otherwise.
285.context: NodeContext: Flirtatious in that special Lae'zel way.

218.speaker: Lae'zel
218.text: Dragons' blood flows in you, does it not? Perhaps you might be availed of the... riches I offer.
218.context: NodeContext: Flirtatious in that special Lae'zel way.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: He might lead us to a cure. Show him some respect - just in case.

361.speaker: Lae'zel
361.text: Respect? Raphael plays a liar's game. Only my kin can purify us.

262.speaker: Lae'zel
262.text: Yet he speaks one truth: we have yet to turn.

172.speaker: Lae'zel
172.text: He knows something. And I mean to know it too.

314.speaker: Player
314.text: You said 'kith'rak' before. What does that mean?

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Those dragon-riders - what do you know of them?

103.speaker: Lae'zel
103.text: They are githyanki knights, the commissars and enforcers of my Queen Vlaakith's will. To die in her name is their last act of reverence.

201.speaker: Lae'zel
201.text: To wield a knight's silver sword is my destiny.

346.speaker: Player
346.text: Recall the kith'raki you saw battle outside the nautiloid. Is knighthood your destiny?

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: I was born to wield the kith'rak's silver sword.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: Vlaakith bestows no greater honour. I was born to wield the kith'rak's silver sword.

166.speaker: Lae'zel
166.text: The traitor Voss waits in Sharess' Caress. We shouldn't keep him waiting.

168.speaker: Lae'zel
168.text: To the inquisitor. He will lead us to the cleansing zaith'isk.

174.speaker: Lae'zel
174.text: Waste no more time. Place the artefact in the Planecaster.

178.speaker: Lae'zel
178.text: Did you see, at the mountain pass crossroads?

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: Tir'su script, scratched in the ground. As I expected: the crèche must be nested in the temple below.

225.speaker: Lae'zel
225.text: Tir'su script, scratched in the ground. The crèche must be nested in the temple below.

184.speaker: Lae'zel
184.text: We have to free Orpheus from his domed prison. And it seems Raphael holds the key.

187.speaker: Lae'zel
187.text: Did you see, near the road that we came from?

142.speaker: Lae'zel
142.text: Tir'su script, scratched in the ground. As I expected: the crèche must be nestled somewhere in these mountains.

317.speaker: Lae'zel
317.text: Tir'su script, scratched in the ground. A crèche must be nestled somewhere in these mountains.

188.speaker: Lae'zel
188.text: Our greed nearly brought Crèche Y'llek to ruin.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Protocol Three-Hundred One: 'Every great tragedy stems from reckless roots.' Words I shan't forget.

209.speaker: Lae'zel
209.text: Forward. The Netherbrain must fall before the Prince of the Comet can grace the Astral Sea.

210.speaker: Lae'zel
210.text: Speak, and be done with it.

211.speaker: Lae'zel
211.text: We must slay the Netherbrain. Right now, that's all that matters.

217.speaker: Lae'zel
217.text: All that remains for us is to return to the Astral Prism and slaughter the false prince.

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: How we get in remains to be seen.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: You have felled a great ch'r'ai, Vlaakith's judgement in flesh.
33.context: NodeContext: cheerkh-RAI (rai pronounced like RYE). Incensed

164.speaker: Lae'zel
164.text: Tsk'va - you hang upon my very last nerve.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: But I still might earn my beloved queen's favour.

358.speaker: Lae'zel
358.text: Insert the artefact into the crèche's planecaster. We will kill the threat inside -

357.speaker: Lae'zel
357.text: - and I will have Vlaakith's eternal regard. She will cleanse me. She will ascend me.

229.speaker: Lae'zel
229.text: To Baldur's Gate. If we're to be free of this parasite, we must slay these Chosen and their captive brain.
229.context: InternalNodeContext: Player entered goblin camp without talking to zorru, zorru still alive

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: In so doing, I will prove my faith to my queen.

230.speaker: Lae'zel
230.text: Not now. I need time to think.
230.context: InternalNodeContext: Player entered goblin camp without talking to zorru, zorru still alive

231.speaker: Lae'zel
231.context: InternalNodeContext: Player entered goblin camp without talking to zorru, zorru still alive

234.speaker: Lae'zel
234.context: InternalNodeContext: Player entered goblin camp without talking to zorru, zorru still alive

238.speaker: Lae'zel
238.text: We have yet to find Zorru. Or have you so quickly forgotten?
238.context: InternalNodeContext: Player entered goblin camp without talking to zorru, zorru still alive

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: He has seen my people. And where we find githyanki, we will find their crèche.

241.speaker: Lae'zel
241.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

243.speaker: Lae'zel
243.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

245.speaker: Lae'zel
245.text: I am Vlaakith's most loyal servant. She will not abandon me.
245.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

249.speaker: Lae'zel
249.text: Tsk'va. What fool would strike our greatest ally?
249.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

250.speaker: Lae'zel
250.text: We must go to Raphael. He holds the key to the prince's release - and his demise.
250.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

253.speaker: Lae'zel
253.text: Inconceivable, that we would seek release from one tadpole only for you to commune with another.
253.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

282.speaker: Lae'zel
282.text: I'd chide you if my mind were not consumed by the sight of Orpheus within his domed prison. The Prince of the Comet lives.

192.speaker: Lae'zel
192.text: I'd chide you if my mind were not consumed by the sight of the fell prince Orpheus within his domed prison.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: But make no mistake, I can see the change in you, feel the parasite worming its way through you even further.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: You have invited your own misery. I will not break our alliance for it - but I will not condone it.

257.speaker: Lae'zel
257.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

260.speaker: Lae'zel
260.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

344.speaker: Lae'zel
344.text: Still - we must use the zaith'isk at the crèche infirmary. It is the only way to cleanse these tadpoles from our brains.

269.speaker: Lae'zel
269.text: To Baldur's Gate. Voss will be waiting in this 'Sharess' Caress'.
269.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

270.speaker: Lae'zel
270.text: Baldur's Gate at last. We should find Sharess' Caress - Voss will be waiting.
270.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

276.speaker: Lae'zel
276.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

278.speaker: Lae'zel
278.text: Voss will be pleased with our progress. Come, to the underground. We must show him the Orphic Hammer.
278.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

284.speaker: Lae'zel
284.text: Chaos surrounds me, lawlessness reigns. Amidst havoc, I must find order.
284.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

126.speaker: Lae'zel
126.text: Orpheus' greatest champion, snuffed out before he could see the Prince of the Comet tear through Realmspace and beyond.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: Tsk'va - there's no time to mourn. We will honour him by breaking the Comet from the sphere that contains him.

288.speaker: Lae'zel
288.text: A welcome face. How can I help?
288.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount, but still very little, affection. Calmly.

291.speaker: Lae'zel
291.text: We must scout the crèche. The purifier - the zaith'isk - will be in the infirmary.

297.speaker: Lae'zel
297.text: In a moment. I need to think.

298.speaker: Lae'zel
298.text: Curious. I took of you completely. Yet your body seems no more worse for wear.

222.speaker: Lae'zel
222.text: Perhaps I might find use for it again...

308.speaker: Lae'zel
308.text: Rest. Weary bones are destined to crack.

315.speaker: Lae'zel
315.text: I will take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael, no matter the cost.

320.speaker: Lae'zel
320.text: I will take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael, no matter the cost.

322.speaker: Lae'zel
322.text: I will take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael, no matter the cost.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: As for the renegade Voss, he waits in the sewers. He could prove an obstacle if we don't take his head.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: Now send over your owner, before you make a mess of things.

327.speaker: Lae'zel
327.text: Wrench the Orphic Hammer from Raphael's grasp and we can usher the prince to his doom, praise Vlaakith.

329.speaker: Lae'zel
329.text: The inquisitor has turned against my infallible queen.

295.speaker: Lae'zel
295.text: We must return to the crèche. I might contact Vlaakith from its command centre.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: No matter - we will grant him a fate more torturous than death: the fall of his beloved Prince Orpheus.

336.speaker: Lae'zel
336.text: Voss is fallen, Vlaakith be praised!

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: And the vaunted blade - it is mine.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: Since I was old enough to hold a blade, I've dreamt of wielding a silver sword.

248.speaker: Lae'zel
248.text: Since I was old enough to hold a blade, I've dreamt of wielding a silver sword.

163.speaker: Lae'zel
163.text: The traitor Prince Orpheus will be next to fall - and the elder brain, after.

339.speaker: Lae'zel
339.text: Voss was meeting someone in Sharess' Caress - someone who possesses the key to Orpheus' prison. We should find them at once.

367.speaker: Lae'zel
367.text: He will be known as an eternal Warrior of Legend. Not just by the githyanki, but by the psalmists and scholars of every plane.

246.speaker: Lae'zel
246.text: For a thousand years, he waited. For a thousand years, he remained faithful to Gith and her royal spawn.

313.speaker: Lae'zel
313.text: We have done him proud - as you have done me.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: You know what to do. When we next enter the Astral Prism, we will break Orpheus free.

352.speaker: Lae'zel
352.text: It'll have to wait until later.

353.speaker: Lae'zel
353.text: To the Crèche Y'llek's command centre. Vlaakith must know of the heresy that's tainted the place.

132.speaker: Lae'zel
132.text: To the Crèche Y'llek's command centre. Vlaakith must know of the heresy that's tainted the place.

266.speaker: Lae'zel
266.text: To the inquisitor at the crèche. The zaith'isk's failure must be reported.

200.speaker: Lae'zel
200.text: These markings - tir'su script, scratched in the ground. As I expected: a crèche must be nested in the temple below.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: These markings - tir'su script, scratched in the ground. A crèche must be nested in the temple below.

307.speaker: Lae'zel
307.text: We must go there at once.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: 'Tir'su script', you said. What does that mean?

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Githyanki writing. Every word a wheel, every letter a spoke.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: The most powerful texts are engraved in slate - some so ancient, only the most erudite gish can read them.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: How do I know I can trust your people?

256.speaker: Lae'zel
256.text: You don't have to trust them - only to trust me.

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: I have not failed you yet and I have no intentions of it now. I don't need you to believe me for it to be true.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: I'll lead us there in my own time. We need to stay close if we're to survive.

258.speaker: Lae'zel
258.text: Chk. Very well. But promise me we will return before our chance is lost, else I make my way there alone.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I promise: we'll go to the crèche before we lose the chance.

124.speaker: Lae'zel
124.text: I expected more from you. If we stray too far, I'll make my way there alone.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: If you want any hope of being rid of that infection, I suggest that you join me.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Wait here for me. I'll return when I'm ready.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: I'll be waiting. Don't take long.

305.speaker: Player
305.text: We'll return when I'm ready, not before.

318.speaker: Player
318.text: Come, let's get to the crèche.

351.speaker: Lae'zel
351.text: But if we stray too far that our chance is lost, I'll make my way there alone.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: Hurry. We are close to our cure.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: These markings - tir'su script, scratched in the ground. As I expected: the crèche must be nestled somewhere in these mountains.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: These markings - tir'su script, scratched in the ground. A crèche must be nestled somewhere in these mountains.

366.speaker: Lae'zel
366.text: We must speak with Raphael. Not later - now.

369.speaker: Lae'zel
369.text: We've come so far. You've a mighty will, that much is certain.
